title: Nashville residents show Jewish solidarity in wake of neo - Nazis converging on city
message:
Residents of Nashville, Tennessee, are showing solidarity with the city's Jewish community, pushing a message of peace in the face of harassment from neo-Nazi and white supremacist groups descending on the city to spew antisemitic hate.
Law enforcement officials and local leaders urged residents not to engage with the group, which authorities said was coming in from outside the city.
According to Nashville police, a member of a "Neo Nazi protest group" carrying a Nazi flag got into an argument with a bartender.

title: Sapphic Shabbat : Queer Jews find sanctuary over Friday night dinner
message:
Sapphic Shabbat has been hosting Friday night dinners for women and non-binary people for the last 12 months.
In addition to dinners, they host meet-ups which welcome the “wider Jewish queer community and allies”.
Most guests have made new friends at the table and there is even a Sapphic Shabbat book group spinoff.
Sapphic Shabbat didn’t do anything for the annual singing contest but some members met independently to watch the show.
As Sapphic Shabbat looks to the future, the trio behind the initiative remain committed to their mission of creating an inclusive, welcoming “community without walls” for queer Jews.

message:
